The seven qualities that Sāriputta had [: Truly understood internally constricted mind as ‘internally constricted mind’
Truly understood externally scattered mind as ‘externally scattered mind’
Knew feelings, perceptions, and thoughts as they arose, as they remained, and as they went away
Properly grasped the patterns of qualities—suitable or unsuitable, inferior or superior, or those on the side of dark or bright
Attended to the patterns of qualities with wisdom
Borne in mind the patterns of qualities with wisdom
